delete_alert_title: Are you sure to delete this version?
delete_confirm_description: Confirm version delete by typing <confirmCode>{{confirmCode}}</confirmCode> below.
name: Version name
deployment_status_empty: We do not have such a view anymore
environment_id_desc: This is your environment's id within your Agnost Cluster.
suspend_services_desc: Suspend access to the execution environment of this version. Version will be kept deployed but no requests will be handled
reactivate_services_desc: Reactivate access to the execution environment of this version.
redeploy_desc: Redeploy latest changes to the environment
auto_redeploy_desc: When version changes then deploy changes automatically
delete_rate_limiter_message: Are you sure you want to delete this rate limiter?, This action cannot be undone.

settings.version_id_desc: This is your base url of your API Server.
settings.version_name_desc: This is your version's name within your Agnost Cluster.
settings.read_only_desc: Set this version as read only. Other team members will be able to view this version but they will not be able to update it, except team members with Admin rights.
settings.private_desc: Set this version as private. Other team members will not be able to view this version, except team members with Admin rights.
settings.endpoint_rate_limit_desc: Rate limiting puts a cap on how often someone can call an endpoint of your app within a certain timeframe. By rate limiting, you can help stop certain kinds of malicious activity. You can define multiple rate limits which are applied sequentially.

authentication.user_data_model_desc: In order to use email, phone or OAuth based authentication, a permanent data model needs to be specified to store user authentication data.
authentication.redirect_url_desc: Your frontend app will be redirected to the default redirect URL when 1) the user is authenticated using an oAuth provider, 2) the user is authenticated using a magic link, 3) the email address of a user is confirmed during sign up, 4) email address change is confirmed, or 5) the password of the user is reset and no matching OS specific redirect URL is identified. An access token which you can use to fetch authentication grants, namely the user and the session data, will be provided as a query string parameter named 'access_token.' Similarly, if the user cannot be authenticated, your frontend app will be redirected to the same redirect URL and an error message will be provided in the query string parameter named 'error.' You can override this URL at environment level and for each different environment of your app you can configure different redirect URLs.
authentication.email_authentication_desc: You can allow your users to sign up using their email addresses and passwords. After signing up, users can use their email address and password to log in. You can also enable/disable email confirmations, meaning when the users are signing up or when they are trying to change their email addresses, you can send a confirmation email to their email address and ask them to click on a confirmation link.
authentication.email_authentication_title: Enable email and password based sign-up in Agnost client library
authentication.confirm_email_desc: If Checked, users need to confirm their email before signing up or changing their email. An email with a confirmation link will be sent to the email address of the user. When the user clicks on the link, Altogic will process the email confirmation request and redirect the user to the Redirect URL specified above with access_token or error as a query string parameter.
authentication.link_expiry_duration_desc: Validity duration of links in seconds. Defaults to 3600 (1 hour), maximum 604,800 seconds (one week).
authentication.own_smtp: Use my own SMTP server to send authentication emails
authentication.own_smtp_desc: If you do not specify your SMTP server, all autharization related emails will be sent from noreply@mail.app.altogic.com. However, there will be daily (100 emails/day) and monthly (1000 emails/month) quotas on the number of emails sent.
authentication.sender_name_desc: Name of the email sender that will appear on the form field.
authentication.sender_email_desc: Sender email that will be used as 'from' address.
authentication.mobile_authentication_desc: You can allow your users to sign up using their mobile phone numbers and passwords. After signing up, users can use their mobile phone number and password to log in. You can also enable/disable phone number confirmations, meaning when the users are signing up or when they are trying to change their mobile phone numbers, you can send a confirmation code and ask them to enter the code included in the SMS to confirm their mobile phone numbers.
authentication.mobile_authentication_title: Enable mobile phone number and password based sign-up in Agnost client library
authentication.confirm_mobile_desc: If checked, users need to confirm their phone number using a code before signing up or changing their phone number.
authentication.allow_signin_codes: Allow Sign-in using authorization codes sent in SMS
authentication.allow_signin_codes_desc: If checked, users can sign in using authorization codes sent in SMS. This option is only available if you have enabled mobile phone number and password based sign-up.
authentication.auth_providers_desc: Add the providers that you want to use to authenticate your application users. Agnost will automatically add required endpoints to your application.
authentication.provider: Stores the type of the authentication provider such as “google” , ”facebook”, “altogic”
authentication.providerUserId: Stores the type of provider user identifier e.9., google user id, facebook user id
authentication.phone: Stores the user’s mobile phone number
authentication.name: Stores the user’s name
authentication.profilePicture: Stores the user’s profile picture if available
authentication.signUpAt: Stores the sign-up date & time of the user
authentication.lastLoginAt: Stores the last login date & time of the user
authentication.emailVerified: Stores whether the user’s email address is verified or not
authentication.phoneVerified: Stores whether the user’s mobile phone number is verified or not
authentication.added_missing_fields: Added missing fields to user data model
authentication.2fa: Stores whether the user’s two factor authentication is enabled or not
authentication.2faSecret: Stores the user’s two factor authentication secret
authentication.oAuth_provider_desc: The {{params}} and Callback/Redirect URL need to authenticate with {{provider}} can be set up from the <platform>{{platform}}</platform>.
authentication.callback_url_desc: Please use this URL below to configure your {{provider}} developer app. You need to copy this URL and add it as a callback or redirect URI in your {{provider}} developer app.
authentication.github: GitHub Docs - Creating an OAuth App
authentication.subject: Subject
authentication.no_providers: No OAuth configuration has been set up.

error_message.label: Error Message
error_message.desc: Error message that will be returned to the calling party when the rate limit is exceeded
error_message.default: Too many requests, please try again later.

limiter_added_to_default: Rate limiter added to default rate limiters

middleware.name: Middleware Name

delete.title: Delete Middleware
delete.message: Are you sure you want to delete this middleware? This action cannot be undone.

middleware.no_middleware_found: You have not defined any middlewares for this app version

npm.name: Package Name
npm.delete_modal_desc: Are you sure you want to delete this package? This action cannot be undone.

variable.delete_modal_desc: Are you sure you want to delete this variable? This action cannot be undone.

api_key.expire_date_desc: Expiration date of API key. For keys without any expiration leave it empty or clear existing value.
api_key.name: Key Name
api_key.all_domains_desc: Can be called from any domain
api_key.all_ips_desc: Can be called from any IP address
api_key.specified_domains_desc: Agnost can limit calls to "Authorized Domains" for application protection.
api_key.specified_ips_desc: Agnost can limit calls to "Authorized IPs" for application protection.
api_key.authorized_ips_desc: IPs that are allowed to use this API key. Leave blank to allow all IPs.
api_key.delete_modal_desc: Are you sure you want to delete this API Key? This action cannot be undone.
api_key.allow_realtime_desc: This API key can be used the font end clients to access realtime services (e.g., sending and receiving messages to and from channels)
api_key.endpoint_access_no_access_desc: The API key cannot be used to call application endpoints
api_key.endpoint_access_full_access_desc: API key can be used with all HTTP methods to view, create, update and delete data
api_key.endpoint_access_custom_allowed_desc: API key can only be used with below allowed endpoints only
api_key.endpoint_access_custom_excluded_desc: API key cannot be used with below excluded endpoints but with all others not selected
api_key.select_endpoint_desc: Click button below to select endpoint

realtime.activate_realtime_desc: Allow clients to publish messages to channels and subscribe them to listen incoming messages
realtime.api_key_required_desc: To use the realtime services of the platform, a vaild API key is required or not. If turned on then the API key needs to to have the "Allow realtime" option turned on.
realtime.session_required_desc: App users are required to be signed in (e.g., have a session token) to use the realtime services through Agnost client library.
realtime.rate_limiter_desc: Rate limiting puts a cap on how often someone can send realtime messages within a certain timeframe. By rate limiting, you can help stop certain kinds of malicious activity. You can define multiple rate limits which are applied sequentially
realtime.endpoint_access_custom_excluded_desc: API key cannot be used with below excluded endpoints but with all others not selected
